# Power BI

To install PowerBI, follow this [link](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=58494) then choose `PBIDesktopSetup_x64.exe`.

# Excel and Google Sheets

Please make sure your computer has Office 365 or Office 2016 installed. For Google Sheets, you will use your university email.

# R Programming 
::: {.panel-tabset group="language"}
## Install R

You can install R on any operating system (OS):

**For Windows** :

-	Download R for Windows OS from this [link](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/)

-	Open the `.exe` file and install it.

**For Mac** :

Download R for Mac via this [link](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/big-sur-arm64/base/R-4.3.3-arm64.pkg). Open the `.pkg` file and install it.

**For Linux**:

For complete R System installation in Linux, follow the instructions on this [link](https://cran.r-project.org/).

For Ubuntu with Apt-get installed, execute `sudo apt-get install r-base` in the terminal.

## Install RStudio

You can install RStudio Click this [link](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download) to install RStudio, choose the appropriate installer file for your operating system, download it, and then run it to install RStudio.
:::


# Python

## Anaconda Distribution

You will need to install Anaconda distribution and you can get it by following this [link](https://www.anaconda.com/download/success).

## VS code

You will also need to install Visual Studio Code by following <https://code.visualstudio.com/download>, then choose your OS.



# Git Bash

To install version control system, please follow this [link](https://git-scm.com/downloads)
